embeds.title: Wide Open
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :e_hermit: / The Hermit / Downfall

Deal 6 (8) damage.
Apply 1 (2) **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable:.

messages.content: Hey Mwalls
it is time for this card
anyways
about Wide Open
it's a fine damage common
and in the lategame, it's there when glare isn't
underwhelming without an upgrade tbh
that much is true
not a must pick in any situation tbh
I've tried using it in act 1 and it feels very bad unupgraded
does improve your vuln consistency, but not your burst
that's true
when I take it in act 1, I basically immediately upgrade it
the main issue with this card unupgraded is hermit already has memento for 1 turn vuln
it's interesting because hermit has two Commons with vulnerable attached to them, and also the starting relic for another vulnerable
really feels like the game is pushing you to take vulnerable at some point in the game and use it in your damage system
so this only lets you keep the vuln for another turn unupgraded- but if you picked a higher damage common attack the enemy would just be dead
most of the time
on the other hand <hermit dead on weak> feels strong even without an upgrade, though the upgrade is high prio

for dead on decks that is
yeah not a great pick for curse decks unless you squeezed in a copy of <take aim>

 ( **Concentrate** :p_concentration:. )
At the start of your turn, **Concentrate** :p_concentration:.

messages.content: block + weak is one of the strongest defensive burst combos
wide open used to be retain, right? what were the exact stats of that version?
wait it did?
yea
ask alex about it
<leg sweep?left my beloved>
I don't think I ever took it
Mostly because hermit has vulnerable in his base kit
And if I ever need more vulnerable I'm taking <glare> over it

embeds.title: Glare
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 0 :e_hermit: / The Hermit / Downfall

 (**Retain**.)
Apply 1 **Weak** :p_weak: and **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable:.

messages.content: so you take a similar stance as Mwalls
Basically yea
Hermit has often times have to play cards in a specific order so having to play a 1 cost attack as your first card just to get the debuff in play can throw a wrench into his gears
what would your idea to make it better be then?
like I actually want to know
I honestly don't know, It seems like the type of card that's destined to be mediocre
Maybe if it had multihit?
That would make it better for sure
More synergies with strength and bruise
I would pick a card that deals 3(4) damage 2 times and applies 1(2) vulnerable
Maybe not always but sometimes
It could also have an entirely unique effect but that would go against hermit philosophy of being closer to base game changers
hermit doesn't have that many multihits, so that probably would improve it
<bounty>, <spray n pray>, <ricochet>, <magnum>

embeds.title: number of items to show must be 1-10

messages.content: holy shit
lmao

I've actually had very good experiences taking this card, though I do highly prioritize the upgrade. A single wide open+ in tandem with your starting memento is often enough to keep vulnerable on key enemies for a very long time, and can even be good enough damage scaling to get through hexaghost or guardian. It is true that glare is also excellent (especially glare+), but it's worse in act 1, especially against gremlin nob and tri sentries. It's rare for pure damage commons to remain relevant into the lategame, and wide open+ tends to remain a very useful source of damage scaling and artifact removal throughout the whole run. It's absolutely critical that you land the strength down from flash powder in fights like the heart, donu and deca, bronze automaton, and shield and spear. I can agree that it's not great without the upgrade, but it can do some very good work once you do upgrade it.
I remember at one point this card was insane
For now, its okay, not the best source of vuln, but it works
would you consider breaking up your analyses into paragraphs in the future? much easier to follow than a block of text

its fine, between this, glare and moment hermit has consistent vulnerable; which helps a lot with bruse and several dead on cards. I think glare is better then this; but if wide open comes first in the run its fine to take.

Having two vulnerable commons makes boss swaping on hermit more viable; I'm still not to sure about boss swapping with him. Swap usually hurts your early game but having a boss relic helps greatly as the run progresses. Since memento tends to fall off; when enemys get tankier you end up holding moment without playing it for several turns to avoid the self vulnerable when it doesn't end the fight for you.
Hermit swap feels pretty similar to defect swap; you like your starter relic a lot at the start of the run but its diminishing returns later makes swapping appealing.
